snippet: Chief Justice Iftikhar Muhammad Chaudhry called the law, which provided greater protection to the prime minister and other senior government officials against such charges, unconstitutional and contrary to the independence of the judiciary.
abstract: Supreme Court of Pakistan strikes down as unconstitutional a controversial law protecting senior officials that the governing party had hoped would help fend off contempt charges against Prime Min Raja Pervez Ashraf.
lead_paragraph: Chief Justice Iftikhar Muhammad Chaudhry called the law, which provided greater protection to the prime minister and other senior government officials against such charges, unconstitutional and contrary to the independence of the judiciary.
